ðŸ”¥ SuperCorners | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide an enhanced and more versatile alternative to macOS's built-in Hot Corners feature, allowing users to trigger a wide variety of actions from additional zones on their screen edges for increased productivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Additional trigger zones on screen edges â€¢ Launch Apps â€¢ Run Shortcuts â€¢ Open Files and Folders
ðŸ“– Summary: SuperCorners is a macOS application that enhances the built-in Hot Corners feature by adding more trigger zones along screen edges and enabling a wider range of actions. It allows users to launch applications, run scripts, open files, and execute system commands directly from these enhanced screen zones, boosting productivity.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ manim-video-generator | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable users to create mathematical animations by simply describing them in natural language, abstracting away the complexity of Manim coding.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generate mathematical animations from text descriptions â€¢ Modern, responsive web interface â€¢ Real-time code preview with syntax highlighting â€¢ Support for various mathematical concepts â€¢ Easy-to-use example prompts
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a web-based tool that generates mathematical animations from natural language descriptions. It leverages OpenAI's GPT models to translate text prompts into Manim code, which then renders complex mathematical visualizations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ WiFiAudioStreaming-Desktop | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Streaming computer audio wirelessly over a local network to other devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Server & Client Modes â€¢ Automatic Discovery â€¢ Unicast & Multicast Support â€¢ Detailed Audio Configuration â€¢ Modern Interface (Jetpack Compose)
ðŸ“– Summary: WiFiAudioStreaming-Desktop is a Kotlin application that transforms your computer into a wireless audio transmitter or receiver. It enables streaming of your PC's internal audio to other devices on the local network, or receiving audio from them, with features like automatic discovery and configurable audio settings.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ komari | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring server performance and status through a web interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight and Efficient â€¢ Self-hosted â€¢ Web Interface
ðŸ“– Summary: Komari is a lightweight, self-hosted server monitoring tool that provides a web interface for viewing server status and collects data via a lightweight agent. It prioritizes low resource consumption and user data privacy.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ go-agent | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building production-ready AI agents in the Go programming language.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modular Architecture â€¢ Multi-Agent Support â€¢ Rich Tooling â€¢ Smart Memory (RAG-powered) â€¢ Model Agnostic LLM Providers
ðŸ“– Summary: The go-agent repository provides a framework for building AI agents in Go, offering features like pluggable LLM providers, tool calling, RAG-powered memory, and multi-agent coordination. It is designed for production use with a focus on performance and idiomatic Go interfaces.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Jauth | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securing self-hosted applications with SSL/TLS and user authorization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Single binary executable with no dependencies â€¢ SSL/TLS encryption using autogenerated self-signed certificates or Let's Encrypt â€¢ User authorization via SSH or Telegram â€¢ Optional Singe Sign-On â€¢ Minimal configuration required
ðŸ“– Summary: Jauth is a Go-based, single-binary reverse proxy that secures self-hosted applications with SSL/TLS encryption and flexible user authorization via SSH or Telegram. It simplifies access management with optional Single Sign-On (SSO) and minimal configuration, making it ideal for protecting web services.
